project.teaser: Food_scalEUp is a collaborative project involving 10 organisations covering 11 regions (5 emerging & moderate innovator regions and 6 leader and strong innovator regions, according to the Regional Innovation Scoreboard) in 5 countries. The project long-term vision is to foster...

article.title: Building a bigger, better digital agri-food acceleration ecosystem in Europe

result.title: Key stakeholders database
result.description: Database with relevant stakeholders in the defined target groups in Europe and beyond It complements the database developed in the ecosystem mapping T12 and feeds into the virtual forum T21

result.title: Report on final take-up events
result.description: Conclusions of the final take-up event in Wageningen and of the regional take-up webinars

result.title: Conflict and Risk Management Plan (II)
result.description: Updated Conflict and Risk Management Plan, including the identification of potentially relevant risks and mitigation measures, as well as procedures to monitor them. (initial version D5.3)

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Plan (I)
result.description: Plan with detailed definition and calendarization of dissemination, exploitation and communication actions. The plan will be updated in M15 based on the results of the monitoring and evaluation of those actions

result.title: Analysis across regional innovation and acceleration ecosystems
result.description: Analysis and conclusions of success and failure factors in scalingup processes

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Plan (II)
result.description: Update of the Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication Plan (D4.1) based on the results of the monitoring and evaluation of those actions

result.title: Virtual forum for agri-food digital innovation and acceleration ecosystems
result.description: Website tool with information about the different digital innovation and acceleration ecosystems, including the identified key actors, programmes, structures, services, financial resources, etc.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - Food-scalEUp (Food-scalEUp: expanding the European digital agri-food acceleration ecosystem)
result.teaser: The agri-food sector is undergoing profound changes driven by digital and green transformation. Many regions struggle to provide support to start-ups growth, particularly in emerging and moderate innovator regions. Food-scalEUp addresses the pressing need to accelerate the...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Business acceleration service portfolio
result.description: Detailed design of the new/improved business acceleration services, including the action plans for them to be adapted and provided in each emerging/moderate innovator regions

result.title: Acceleration ecosystems mapping
result.description: Mapping of the actors in the agrifood digital innovation and acceleration ecosystem in each of the project regions

result.title: Recommendations for policy-makers involved in acceleration and business growth
result.description: Recommendations for policy-making based on the conclusions of WP4 but also of WP3, aiming to suggest policy and strategic improvements to better support business acceleration and growth.

result.title: Report on Dissemination, Exploitation and Communication activities
result.description: Report on results of the dissemination, exploitation and communication actions implemented during the project

result.title: Recommendations for business acceleration providers
result.description: Detailed recommendations for business acceleration providers, as well as for other key actors in acceleration ecosystems, based on the experiences of the pilots implemented.

result.title: Characterisation of start-ups and SMEs
result.description: Report with results of the characterisation of scaleups startups and SMEs conducted

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
